reviewText:
Early Access Review

I played very little of this game because honestly, I couldn't play it.
It's horrible, the soundtrack is okay; but the gameplay is if not worse than a flash game made in one day.
The concept of the game seems like an alright idea, but honestly the game in its current state is so trash I couldn't see how anyone could get enjoyment out of playing this. Not even worth the .99 price tag.
The barbaric saving system and extremely limited UI will give you a blast from the past, all the way back to the late 90s. I would like to see some of that get fixed, because as I said I believe the game has good intentions.
This game is certainly nowhere close to being called finished"
recommended: if the creators do not decide to apply some extra effort to this game
hoursPlayed: I would not recommend getting it at all."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Logic Missile is a deceptively simple flash game that looks fairly easy at first glance, but once you actually get into the later levels, you will really need to use your critical thinking to get past obstacles and traps. The soundtrack doesn't really add anything to the experience (if anything it could be worked on), but it's the gameplay that will require the user to have extreme platforming precision, timing and skill. The instant saving feature is extremely important to use, as you will die a lot in this game, perhaps more than you ever would in the Dark Souls games (I know it's a completely different genre of game). Some of the platforming sections are extremely difficult (I get flashbacks of the original Rayman) That will require hours of trial and error. I am currently on Level 10.

Logic Missile will test your patience, which is what any good puzzle game should do in my opinion. It's honestly refreshing to see a challenging game in an age of overly \hand-holding" games that are released. For 99 cents
date: I think this game is definitely worth taking a crack at if you are a big fan of retro-style platforming puzzle gameplay."
helpfulPercent: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
